title: Best Cyber Monday Deals 2024: There's Still 80+ Sales Still Live You Can Shop Right Now
description: CNET's shopping experts have found all the best deals on TVs, tablets, smart home gadgets and more still up for grabs post-Cyber Monday.
author: Adam Oram
excerpt: Cyber Monday has come and gone but CNET's shopping experts have found all the best remaining deals on TVs, tablets, smart home gadgets and more.
text: Our expert, award-winning staff selects the products we cover and rigorously researches and tests our top picks. If you buy through our links, we may get a commission. Reviews ethics statement Adam Oram Senior Editor Adam Oram is a Senior Editor at CNET. He studied Media at Newcastle University and has been writing about technology since 2013. He previously worked as a Senior Writer at iMore, Deals Editor at Thrifter, and as an Apple Genius. His spare time is spent watching football (both kinds), playing Pokémon games, and eating vegan food. Expertise Deals | Apple CNET’s expert staff reviews and rates dozens of new products and services each month, building on more than a quarter century of expertise. Cyber Monday has technically ended, but a lot of sales are still going strong. Now is your last chance to cash in on some of the biggest deals of the year. Whether you're shopping for holiday gifts or looking to treat yourself to something nice, now is the time to act. This year's Cyber Week has brought stellar savings on laptops, TVs, tablets, mattresses and headphones, among other great buys. And we're continuing the fun by monitoring all of the best Cyber Week deals until they run out.This page serves as your personal deal-hunting companion. We're updating it regularly with Cyber Monday's remaining top sales items from CNET's shopping experts. Keep an eye on this space so you won't miss any amazing deals as things dwindle. Best Cyber Monday deals Get the best Android smartwatch experience with the improved health sensor array, the smoother yet more efficient processor and the new gesture controls on the Galaxy Watch 7. Samsung's Galaxy Health suite remains entirely free -- unlike Fitbit on the Pixel Watch 3 -- and its integration with both Samsung Galaxy phones and non-Samsung Android phones is top tier. Samsung's customizable watch faces, like the new Ultra Info Board or the updated (and GIF-supporting) Photos face, let your watch feel as futuristic, retro or personal as you desire. Apple users, listen up! This tiny Bluetooth tracker can help you find your lost keys or wallet. And this 4-pack can be yours at a great price. The TCL QM8 offers superior brightness levels and top-notch picture quality thanks to its use of cutting-edge mini-LED technology. No wonder it was our top pick for the best TV set of 2024.  If you've been wanting to upgrade your phone, the Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra is 25% off right now. The S24 Ultra has a sharp 5x optical zoom, fast processor and a beautiful display so you'll have plenty of room to play with Samsung's new Galaxy AI features. This is also one of our favorite Samsung phones of the year. These 2024 Beats are some of our favorite over-ear headphones available at the moment. They're not noise-canceling, but do support lossless audio, boast solid voice-call performance and impressed our reviewers with their substantial 50-hour battery life.  Drinking lukewarm tea or coffee is nobody's idea of a good time.  This mug is perfect for those of us who never quite finish a drink before it goes cold. It has an 80-minute battery so keeps your drink warm for well over an hour and you can control the whole thing using your phone. Keep your home the perfect temperature as the cold winds blow this season. This Honeywell thermostat is Energy Star certified and may help you save on your electric bill. Cricut's biggest sale of the year has knocked a whopping $100 off this bundle, including one of our favorite, editor-tested Cricut machines. Razer Viper V2 Pro HyperSpeed wireless gaming mouse: $80 (save $70). This mouse is a solid tool for competitive PC gaming thanks to its lightweight edge and it's now at the lowest price we've seen in 2024.Roku Streaming Stick 4K: $29 (save $20). Get the Roku platform on almost any TV. This media streamer supports 4K, HDR and Dolby Vision. And it comes with a Roku voice remote.Aqara U100 smart door lock: $135 (save $95). This smart lock supports Apple's Home Key technology, Amazon's Alexa and more.Google Nest Audio smart speaker: $50 (save $50). Nab a quality smart speaker at half price.  Roku Streambar SE: $69 (save $31). Roku's 2-in-1 sound and streaming bar is over 30% off. CNET's David Carnoy recommends the Streambar SE from Roku as a "solid upgrade over most built-in TV speakers."JBL Clip 5: $50 (save $30). One of our favorite Bluetooth speakers is down to its lowest price with a 12-hour battery, IP67 waterproof and dustproof protection and an integrated carabiner so it can clip onto your bag. Updated Live: Best Cyber Monday Deals According to CNET Readers Best Cyber Monday TV dealsWe're serious about TVs here at CNET, and the proud owners of a light-controlled TV Test Lab at our New York City office. As our shopping editors evaluate the best Cyber Monday deals on TVs, we cross-reference the discounts with the results of our rigorous hands-on testing -- and consult our dedicated TV editors and writers, too. These are our favorites right now.  Sony/CNET This 2023 Sony model is down by a big $400 with an even bigger 75-inch 4K screen. It sports HDR 10, HLG, Dolby Vision, a 120Hz frame rate, four HDMI inputs and Sony's XR Contrast Booster which is great for getting deeper black and increased brightness. Show more A 55-inch display is large enough for most spaces, and this particular model is equipped with an OLED screen. It also has Dolby Atmos sound, Dolby Vision, an A11 AI processor with upscaling and gaming features such as Nvidia G Sync, AMD FreeSync Premium and up to 144Hz refresh rate.  This smart TV defines "Go big or go home." It's 85 inches, making it almost too big for most spaces, but just right for those who love watching movies large and loud or like to catch all the details of any sport you can imagine. Its smarts come from Google TV and includes a subwoofer built-in to make the sound experience better in almost every case. Outdoor TVs are built differently compared to the wishy-washy indoor TVs. They have large surroundings that keep them from getting too hot or too cold, and they can withstand water splashes. This 43-inch 4K TV from Sylvox runs Google TV as well, so you can hang out on your deck and stream your favorite shows in the sunshine. If you want a streaming-ready TV, this 75-inch Roku model has convenient features and excellent image quality, from the 4K resolution QLED screen to Dolby Vision and Atmos. Amazon 65-inch Fire TV Omni Series: $600 (save $200). This TV has Dolby Vision IQ, HDR10 Plus Adaptive, HDR10 and HLG, along with a built-in sensor for adaptive brightness and hands-free Alexa for voice control.Samsung Class DU6950 Crystal 4K smart TV: $550 (save $200). Samsung's Crystal UHD is a great entry point to its 4K models and some of its best outside of the QLED range. Hisense 55-inch ULED 4K smart TV: $698 (save $402). Hisense panels offer excellent color quality, and the 140Hz refresh rate gives a real boost to your gaming experience.  TCL 65-inch S5-Series 4K TV: $360 (save $70). This TV runs on Google's platform, has a 4K display and Dolby Atmos audio, and has Apple AirPlay.Amazon Fire TV 40-inch 2-Series: $150 (save $100). This TV has an Alexa voice remote and is compact for playrooms, dens, offices and other small spaces. LG 77-inch C3 OLED evo 4K TV: $2,000 (save $300). This 2023 model can help you save on an impressive 77-inch OLED display. It also has Dolby Vision and Dolby Atmos for solid visuals and sound.Best Cyber Monday smart home dealsCyber Monday is the perfect opportunity to upgrade your smart home setup, whether you're eyeing a security camera or multicolored light bulbs. CNET's experts have compiled the best deals you can find on gear that will help with everything from maintaining the ideal temperature to purifying the air you breathe. These high-tech essentials can often be pricey -- but not when these rare deals come around. Amazon/CNET This Amazon Echo Show 5 smart speaker is the latest model with improved bass and clearer sound. The 5.5-inch display offers a way to watch content, view security cameras and more. Show more Especially as we approach the winter months, this fourth-gen smart thermostat can help you save on your heating bill by optimizing the temperature of your home. Not to mention you can save $50 on it right now, too.Specs: Remote programmable; voltage: 24V; dimensions: 1.21 x 3.3 x 3.3 inches (DWH) Named the best air purifier, this smart device stays on top of allergens and pollutants by auto-adjusting to its environment. Breathe in cleaner air with $69 off the regular price. Amazon's Echo Show 8 is an impressive smart display with an 8-inch HD touchscreen, a 13MP camera and a built-in microphone to let you check the weather, set timers, update your calendar and more, hands-free. This bundle also includes a free Energetic smart bulb. Amazon's Echo Pop is a solid entry-level smart speaker and bundled with the Echo Frames, you won't see a better deal. With Alexa built into your glasses, you'll have access to all you need, including those epic playlists while on the go. Taking your meat out of the oven or opening the grill can be a hassle and it gives you a less accurate read. With this smart meat thermometer, you can monitor your food's temperature from your phone as it cooks. Veise smart lock: $80 (save $100 with on-page coupon). Upgrade your home security setup with a new smart lock. This lock is easy to set up and can be unlocked in multiple ways, including with your biometrics, a touchscreen keypad, a standard key and more.Govee Floor lamp: $90 (save $60). Add ambient smart lighting to any space with this RGBIC LED lamp with over 64 scenes and music sync. Just clip the on-page coupon for this price.TP-Link Tapo smart Wi-Fi plug (3-pack): $23 (save $27). Not only can you save on these plugs, you can save on your electric bill with the Tapo app that lets you control when your plugs are on and off.Kasa smart LED light strip: $15 (save $10). Accent your home with the 16 million different colors of this smart light strip.Amazon Echo Pop: $18 (save $22). Amazon's smallest and most budget-friendly Alexa speaker just got cheaper. The Echo Pop is the perfect addition to any smart home, especially if you're just starting out.Philips Hue A19 smart bulb (2-pack): $65 (save $25). Nab two impressive smart light bulbs in this multipack. Be sure to clip the on-page coupon for the full discount.Best Cyber Monday headphone dealsA good pair of headphones, Airpods or wireless earbuds make relaxing with music easy. Top headphones and earbuds from top brands like Apple, Sony, Bose and more are on sale for Cyber Monday. We've gathered the best audio deals for you below across multiple big retailers, including Amazon, Best Buy and Walmart. Bose/CNET According to CNET's resident audio expert, the Bose QuietComfort earbuds offer "a lot to like for the price," and they're even more likable at $50 off. They boast solid sound quality that lives up to the Bose reputation, and the sleek, stemless design provides a snug, comfortable fit (for most people). Show more If you want the sound quality of the AirPods Pro with the comfort and security of over-ear headphones, the AirPods Max are for you. When all else fails, USB-C earbuds ensure you're never without music. Very, very, very few phones still have 3.5mm headphone jacks anymore, so if you want to keep a pair of spare earbuds in your car or your bag that won't need charging, you'll want a sturdy pair of USB-C earbuds like the JBL Tune 310C. With in-line controls and a microphone, they can be used for calls, music, or dissuading small talk on the holiday flight home. The headphones are still $80 off post-Cyber Monday. Kiss those noisy upstairs neighbors and those crying kids on the holiday flight home goodbye with Bose's top-notch noise-canceling headphones. While the spatial audio is neat, the automatic wake/sleep and play/pause based on on-ear detection make the QuietComfort Ultra feel magical. Swapping between multiple devices is also a breeze, even if it's not quite as seamless as Sony. Amazon's Echo Buds are surprisingly high-tech for their price point, especially at the current 50% off. From the Alexa integration to automatically pausing when you take them out of your ears, these affordable earbuds are worth the savings. Anker Soundcore Space A40 ANC earbuds: $50 (save $50). Noise-canceling earbuds at half price? Yes, please. Just $50 gets you up to 50 hours of playtime total.Sennheiser Momentum 4: $230 (save $150). A premium pair of ANC headphones for serious audiophiles. These also made our best headphones list.Sony WH-1000XM5: $298 (save $102). Cut out the noise with Sony's flagship headphones. These headphones ranked as one of our favorite pair of headphones, making them an excellent choice. JBL Tune 720BT headphones: $40 (save $40). These over-ear headphones deliver up to 76 hours of battery life per charge, have multipoint Bluetooth connectivity and fold for easy travel or storage.EarFun Wave Pro: $64 (save $16). With 80 hours of battery life, CNET's favorite noise-canceling headphones for those on a budget are made even cheaper for Cyber Monday.JBL Tune 670NC headphones: $50 (save $50): Get good sound quality with noise cancelation at 50% off.Best Cyber Monday tech dealsCyber Monday deals are still lingering, and that means amazing tech deals. Whether you've been looking to get some electronics for your kid or just replace your outdated tech around the house, our Cyber Monday picks will have something for you. We've picked the best tech deals from top brands like Apple with great discounts on tablets, iPhones and other electronics across retailers like Amazon, Best Buy and Walmart. CNET/Govee This kit adds lights to the back of your TV that sync up with whatever you are watching or playing. There are kits for multiple TV sizes on sale right now. Clip the on-page coupon for the discount.  Show more Each shade and series of Oura's third-gen ring gets lowest price yet. Calling all gamers. If you're looking to get your hands on a new console, grab this deal that brings down Sony's Slim PS5 to the lowest price we've seen. Take 20% off a stocking-sized speaker in nine super-fun colorways. This is Samsung's latest foldable phone with a large 7.6-inch internal display and fast chip. Need more than 256GB of storage? You can save the same $200 on the 512GB model, too. UE's smallest, newest Bluetooth speaker gets its first big discount. While the Wonderboom usually wins Black Friday, the new Miniroll stole our hearts with its ultra-portable form factor and easy-to-mount backstrap. It can party all day (or night) with its 12-hour battery life, and UE finally used USB-C to charge the Miniroll, so no more digging out a micro-USB cable for this micro speaker. Not only does this HD monitor offer sharp image quality with a 1,920x1,080-pixel screen, but it also has adaptive sync. This means it matches up with the refresh rate of your graphics card in your computer, up to 120Hz. It's also very easy on the eyes, with a built-in blue light shield. Nebula Cosmos 4K SE smart projector: $1,100 (save $200). This projector has Dolby Vision, 1,800 ANSI lumens and a huge 200 inch screen.Bose SoundLink Max portable speaker: $299 (save $100). This waterproof Bluetooth speaker delivers up to 20 hour of battery life per charge so you can keep the music going all day long.Baseus Magsafe portable charger: $27 (save $33). Get this portable charger with a 10,000-mAh capacity and MagSafe design at a 50% discount, plus clip the extra 10% off coupon.Samsung T7 Shield 2TB portable SSD: $150 (save $135). Backup your most important files and data on this rugged portable hard drive.Best Cyber Monday laptop and tablet dealsThere are tons of amazing Cyber Monday deals still going on. Now is a great time to get a new laptop or Chromebook to replace your aging machine. There are plenty of laptop deals, whether you want a shiny gaming laptop, a reliable MacBook or a budget Chromebook for your kid. If you don't see something you like below, check our complete list of the best Cyber Monday laptop deals. And for those looking for something more portable, we've gathered great tablet deals that range from low-cost Fire tablets to price cuts on popular iPad models. Apple/CNET With an 11-inch Ultra Retina XDR display, an M4 chip, 256GB of storage and support for Wi-Fi 6E, this powerful Apple tablet is perfect for creatives. Show more This 2024 laptop has a touchscreen display, 16GB of RAM and 512GB of SSD storage. It also has the Snapdragon X Elite processor, AI capabilities through Copilot Plus and gets up to 20 hours of battery life. Whether for streaming or light gaming, this under-$200 Chromebook is a bargain. The laptop can charge from zero to 50% in 45 minutes, and it has 64GB of storage and 16GB of RAM. Asus ROG Strix G16 gaming laptop: $1,249 (save $151). With a 16-inch display, Nvidia GeForce RTX 4060 graphics and 1TB of SSD storage, you can easily game on the go. Apple iPad Pro M2 (11-inch): $1,099 (save $400). This previous-gen tablet still packs a punch for creatives looking for a deal.Samsung Galaxy Tab A9 Plus 11-inch tablet: $149 (save $71). An affordable Android tablet that sports a large 11-inch display and quad speakers for an excellent multimedia experience.Lenovo LOQ 15.6-inch gaming laptop: $600 (save $600). A big discount on this model gets you an Intel Core i5 processor, RTX 3050, 512GB SSD and 12GB RAM.Dell Inspiron 16 Plus 7640 laptop: $1,100 (save $400). This budget pick for creators has a 16-inch 2.5K IPS display, RTX graphics, an Intel Core Ultra CPU and an RTX 4060 GPU, as well as 16GB of RAM and 1TB of SSD storage.Asus 14-inch laptop: $120 (save $110). A budget laptop under the $100 mark with 4GB RAM, Intel-Celeron-N6000 processor, 64GB storage, Windows 11 OS and UMA graphics. Samsung Galaxy Tab S9 Ultra: $800 (save $400). This powerful Android tablet has a 14.6-inch dynamic AMOLED 2X screen, Galaxy AI with Circle to Search and comes with an S-Pen.Best Cyber Monday kitchen and home dealsCyber Monday is a great time to upgrade your home and kitchen tools without spending a fortune. Whether you've been eyeing a new vacuum or thinking about finally getting that robot vacuum, we've rounded up the best deals for you below. And if you're hunting for budget-friendly options, don't miss our picks for the best Cyber Monday Deals Under $100 and Under $50. Sensio / CNET A 1500-watt Bella Pro with six quarts that can serve five to seven people. It's easy to clean with a removable ceramic nonstick basket and crisping tray, both of which are dishwasher-friendly. It then has a touchscreen with adjustable cooking temperatures up to 400 degrees Fahrenheit. Show more The Anova Sous Vide is designed to offer precise cooking times and temperature readings while you cook, so that your food comes out tender and perfectly cooked. You can use it to cook a variety of dishes such as various meats, seafood, eggs, vegetables and more, though steak is one of the most popular uses. The Anova app lets you control the Sous Vide tool via Bluetooth and track the temperature. If you want added features like guided cooking, multi-device connectivity and recipes, you can upgrade to the paid version of the app. The Dyson V8 is a somewhat older model but still an extremely reliable, powerful Dyson vacuum for hundreds less than the brand's latest cleaning tech. The compact-sized Keurig K-Slim can serve up cups as large as 12 ounces. The built-in water reservoir is good for multiple brews, and you can even slot in a travel-sized mug to brew up some fresh coffee for your morning commute. Its energy saver function saves power. This popular hair tool from Dyson has six attachments, including the Airwrap curling barrels that have revolutionized hair styling. Save a rare $110 on this sleek multifunctional gadget. Bring the local cafe to your house with a record-low price on the Breville espresso machine. This machine comes with all the bells and whistles, including a beans grinder and a milk frother. Make your fancy coffees at home with the touch of a button and stop dishing out money at the coffee shop every day.  This robot vacuum and mop combo cleaner offers 6,000Pa suction power, reactive AI obstacle avoidance and sonic mapping, a dual rubber brush system to collect pet hair and other debris and a mopping function that uses vibration and downward pressure to remove dried spills and more. This deal is only available to Amazon Prime members, unfortunately. We named the Aventon Soltera 2 the overall best e-bike of 2024 in large part thanks to its simple design, seven-speed cassette and detailed LCD display. It features a 350-watt motor, a top speed of 20 mph and a maximum range of up to 46 miles. It's also equipped with integrated lights and turn signals and has four levels of pedal assistance. Some variations are sold out, but others are still in stock based on the color and height you're looking for. Tineco Pure One S11 cordless vacuum cleaner: $210 (save $90). This lightweight Tineco was chosen as our pick for the overall best cordless vacuum of the year thanks to its strong suction, HEPA filtration and more. Clip the on-page coupon for the discount.TheraGun Sense massage gun: $199 (save $100). This percussion massager can help tackle muscle soreness and pain.KitchenAid 5.5-quart Bowl-Lift stand mixer: $280 (save $170). Nothing beats a stand mixer. Add this classic to your kitchen arsenal to make cooking and baking easier. Bissell Little Green Carpet Cleaner: $81 (save $42). Grab this viral carpet cleaner at its lowest price since 2019.Sperax walking pad: $120 (save $60). Get those steps in with this 3-in-1 portable walking pad. It fits anywhere, even under your desk so you can multitask during long meetings. Clip the on-page coupon for the full discount.When is Cyber Monday?Cyber Monday happened on Dec. 2nd. It always lands the Monday after Thanksgiving in the US, which falls on the fourth Thursday of November. There are hundreds of price cuts and sizable sales from the biggest online retailers, some of which are carry-overs from Black Friday you can still snag right now and many that are brand new deals to enjoy.Which stores have Cyber Monday sales?Almost all major retailers offer tons of deals and discounts for Cyber Monday. Think the likes of Amazon, Best Buy and Walmart, as well as more specialized retailers such as B&H Photo, GameStop and Dell. Major retailers with brick-and-mortar locations -- such as Target and Walmart -- will be offering online-only savings, whereas Best Buy's Cyber Monday deals are both in-store and online. Keep in mind physical locations can also run out of stock. We've researched Cyber Monday store hours to help you shop in person, too.When do Cyber Monday sales end?Just like Black Friday, these sales tend to last a few days after the major sales event itself, which is Dec. 2 this year. With this in mind, it's fair to assume offers will run throughout the weekend into early December. Just note that the best deals are expected on the main Cyber Monday date, unless the retailer has decided to extend sales from Black Friday.Are Cyber Monday deals only available online?Generally speaking, yes. Cyber Monday has always existed as a digital version of Black Friday, focused largely on tech deals that exist separate from the first event. As more and more shopping is done online, these two shopping events have started to blend together a little. That doesn't mean all of the deals are the same, but it does mean finding new deals has started to become a greater challenge. Best Cyber Monday retailersAmazon: One of the biggest online retailers, Amazon has massive discounts with significant savings on tech, home appliances, and smart home equipment. Walmart: Save big on appliances like televisions, refrigerators, laptops, and more at Walmart's Cyber Monday event.Best Buy: Cyber Monday is historically a great time to buy TVs and Best Buy has you covered for that and more.The Home Depot: Eyeing home improvement tools? Home Depot has the best discounts on tools, appliances, and even grills.Target: Target may not be as big on Cyber Monday as other retailers but it does offer some great deals on toys, gifts and board games.Why are they called Black Friday and Cyber Monday?The term "black" has historically been used to denote distressing or calamitous events. The earliest known use of Black Friday for the Friday after Thanksgiving was to refer to the practice of workers calling in sick the day after Thanksgiving in the early 1950s. Around that same time, US police adopted the term to describe the traffic conditions during the first major holiday shopping date. After attempts to move to the term "Big Friday" failed, merchants attempted to ameliorate the term Black Friday in subsequent years, suggesting that its origin was not due to the terrible traffic the shopping spree created, but because the profit it generated put stores "back in the black" in financial terms. Then, in 2005, the National Retail Federation coined the term "Cyber Monday" because it had noticed a spike in online traffic the Monday following Thanksgiving. At the time, it was believed it was because people were making online purchases while they were at work following the holiday, so their kids couldn't see any gift purchases and because work computers typically had faster internet connections. There was some chatter about calling the date Black Monday or Blue Monday -- because hyperlinks are blue -- but eventually, everyone settled on the more futuristic-sounding Cyber Monday. In 2014, Cyber Monday became the biggest online shopping day in the country.
html:
Our expert, award-winning staff selects the products we cover and rigorously researches and tests our top picks. If you buy through our links, we may get a commission.

Reviews ethics statement

Adam Oram Senior Editor

Adam Oram is a Senior Editor at CNET. He studied Media at Newcastle University and has been writing about technology since 2013. He previously worked as a Senior Writer at iMore, Deals Editor at Thrifter, and as an Apple Genius. His spare time is spent watching football (both kinds), playing Pokémon games, and eating vegan food.

Expertise Deals | Apple

CNET’s expert staff reviews and rates dozens of new products and services each month, building on more than a quarter century of expertise.

Cyber Monday has technically ended, but a lot of sales are still going strong. Now is your last chance to cash in on some of the biggest deals of the year. Whether you're shopping for holiday gifts or looking to treat yourself to something nice, now is the time to act. This year's Cyber Week has brought stellar savings on laptops, TVs, tablets, mattresses and headphones, among other great buys. And we're continuing the fun by monitoring all of the best Cyber Week deals until they run out.

This page serves as your personal deal-hunting companion. We're updating it regularly with Cyber Monday's remaining top sales items from CNET's shopping experts. Keep an eye on this space so you won't miss any amazing deals as things dwindle. 

Best Cyber Monday deals

Get the best Android smartwatch experience with the improved health sensor array, the smoother yet more efficient processor and the new gesture controls on the Galaxy Watch 7. Samsung's Galaxy Health suite remains entirely free -- unlike Fitbit on the Pixel Watch 3 -- and its integration with both Samsung Galaxy phones and non-Samsung Android phones is top tier. Samsung's customizable watch faces, like the new Ultra Info Board or the updated (and GIF-supporting) Photos face, let your watch feel as futuristic, retro or personal as you desire.

Apple users, listen up! This tiny Bluetooth tracker can help you find your lost keys or wallet. And this 4-pack can be yours at a great price.

The TCL QM8 offers superior brightness levels and top-notch picture quality thanks to its use of cutting-edge mini-LED technology. No wonder it was our top pick for the best TV set of 2024. 

If you've been wanting to upgrade your phone, the Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra is 25% off right now. The S24 Ultra has a sharp 5x optical zoom, fast processor and a beautiful display so you'll have plenty of room to play with Samsung's new Galaxy AI features. This is also one of our favorite Samsung phones of the year.

These 2024 Beats are some of our favorite over-ear headphones available at the moment. They're not noise-canceling, but do support lossless audio, boast solid voice-call performance and impressed our reviewers with their substantial 50-hour battery life. 

Drinking lukewarm tea or coffee is nobody's idea of a good time.  This mug is perfect for those of us who never quite finish a drink before it goes cold. It has an 80-minute battery so keeps your drink warm for well over an hour and you can control the whole thing using your phone.

Keep your home the perfect temperature as the cold winds blow this season. This Honeywell thermostat is Energy Star certified and may help you save on your electric bill.

Cricut's biggest sale of the year has knocked a whopping $100 off this bundle, including one of our favorite, editor-tested Cricut machines.

  • Razer Viper V2 Pro HyperSpeed wireless gaming mouse: $80 (save $70). This mouse is a solid tool for competitive PC gaming thanks to its lightweight edge and it's now at the lowest price we've seen in 2024.
  • Roku Streaming Stick 4K: $29 (save $20). Get the Roku platform on almost any TV. This media streamer supports 4K, HDR and Dolby Vision. And it comes with a Roku voice remote.
  • Aqara U100 smart door lock: $135 (save $95). This smart lock supports Apple's Home Key technology, Amazon's Alexa and more.
  • Google Nest Audio smart speaker: $50 (save $50). Nab a quality smart speaker at half price.  
  • Roku Streambar SE: $69 (save $31). Roku's 2-in-1 sound and streaming bar is over 30% off. CNET's David Carnoy recommends the Streambar SE from Roku as a "solid upgrade over most built-in TV speakers."
  • JBL Clip 5: $50 (save $30). One of our favorite Bluetooth speakers is down to its lowest price with a 12-hour battery, IP67 waterproof and dustproof protection and an integrated carabiner so it can clip onto your bag.

Updated Live: Best Cyber Monday Deals According to CNET Readers

Best Cyber Monday TV deals

We're serious about TVs here at CNET, and the proud owners of a light-controlled TV Test Lab at our New York City office. As our shopping editors evaluate the best Cyber Monday deals on TVs, we cross-reference the discounts with the results of our rigorous hands-on testing -- and consult our dedicated TV editors and writers, too. These are our favorites right now. 

This 2023 Sony model is down by a big $400 with an even bigger 75-inch 4K screen. It sports HDR 10, HLG, Dolby Vision, a 120Hz frame rate, four HDMI inputs and Sony's XR Contrast Booster which is great for getting deeper black and increased brightness.

Show more

A 55-inch display is large enough for most spaces, and this particular model is equipped with an OLED screen. It also has Dolby Atmos sound, Dolby Vision, an A11 AI processor with upscaling and gaming features such as Nvidia G Sync, AMD FreeSync Premium and up to 144Hz refresh rate. 

This smart TV defines "Go big or go home." It's 85 inches, making it almost too big for most spaces, but just right for those who love watching movies large and loud or like to catch all the details of any sport you can imagine. Its smarts come from Google TV and includes a subwoofer built-in to make the sound experience better in almost every case.

Outdoor TVs are built differently compared to the wishy-washy indoor TVs. They have large surroundings that keep them from getting too hot or too cold, and they can withstand water splashes. This 43-inch 4K TV from Sylvox runs Google TV as well, so you can hang out on your deck and stream your favorite shows in the sunshine.

When is Cyber Monday?

Cyber Monday happened on Dec. 2nd. It always lands the Monday after Thanksgiving in the US, which falls on the fourth Thursday of November. There are hundreds of price cuts and sizable sales from the biggest online retailers, some of which are carry-overs from Black Friday you can still snag right now and many that are brand new deals to enjoy.

Which stores have Cyber Monday sales?

Almost all major retailers offer tons of deals and discounts for Cyber Monday. Think the likes of Amazon, Best Buy and Walmart, as well as more specialized retailers such as B&H Photo, GameStop and Dell. Major retailers with brick-and-mortar locations -- such as Target and Walmart -- will be offering online-only savings, whereas Best Buy's Cyber Monday deals are both in-store and online. Keep in mind physical locations can also run out of stock. We've researched Cyber Monday store hours to help you shop in person, too.

When do Cyber Monday sales end?

Just like Black Friday, these sales tend to last a few days after the major sales event itself, which is Dec. 2 this year. With this in mind, it's fair to assume offers will run throughout the weekend into early December. Just note that the best deals are expected on the main Cyber Monday date, unless the retailer has decided to extend sales from Black Friday.

Are Cyber Monday deals only available online?

Generally speaking, yes. Cyber Monday has always existed as a digital version of Black Friday, focused largely on tech deals that exist separate from the first event. As more and more shopping is done online, these two shopping events have started to blend together a little. That doesn't mean all of the deals are the same, but it does mean finding new deals has started to become a greater challenge. 

Best Cyber Monday retailers

  • Amazon: One of the biggest online retailers, Amazon has massive discounts with significant savings on tech, home appliances, and smart home equipment. 
  • Walmart: Save big on appliances like televisions, refrigerators, laptops, and more at Walmart's Cyber Monday event.
  • Best Buy: Cyber Monday is historically a great time to buy TVs and Best Buy has you covered for that and more.
  • The Home Depot: Eyeing home improvement tools? Home Depot has the best discounts on tools, appliances, and even grills.
  • Target: Target may not be as big on Cyber Monday as other retailers but it does offer some great deals on toys, gifts and board games.

Why are they called Black Friday and Cyber Monday?

The term "black" has historically been used to denote distressing or calamitous events. The earliest known use of Black Friday for the Friday after Thanksgiving was to refer to the practice of workers calling in sick the day after Thanksgiving in the early 1950s. Around that same time, US police adopted the term to describe the traffic conditions during the first major holiday shopping date. 

After attempts to move to the term "Big Friday" failed, merchants attempted to ameliorate the term Black Friday in subsequent years, suggesting that its origin was not due to the terrible traffic the shopping spree created, but because the profit it generated put stores "back in the black" in financial terms. 

Then, in 2005, the National Retail Federation coined the term "Cyber Monday" because it had noticed a spike in online traffic the Monday following Thanksgiving. At the time, it was believed it was because people were making online purchases while they were at work following the holiday, so their kids couldn't see any gift purchases and because work computers typically had faster internet connections. There was some chatter about calling the date Black Monday or Blue Monday -- because hyperlinks are blue -- but eventually, everyone settled on the more futuristic-sounding Cyber Monday. In 2014, Cyber Monday became the biggest online shopping day in the country.
